Standard Trap.command:
[h:''] [h:me = arg(0)] [h:event = arg(1)] [h:triggerType = arg(5)] [h:assert(triggerType == "pad" || triggerType == "area", "The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: "+triggerType+" to this pad", 0)] [h:switchToken(me)] [h:attackRoll = d20] [h:roll=1d6] [h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity):HP=HP-roll] [h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity):broadcast("You have triggered a trap and sustained "+roll+" hits.
")]
Standard Trap.label: Standard Trap

Standard Pit.command:
[h:''] [h:me = arg(0)] [h:event = arg(1)] [h:padName = arg(2)] [h:lastPath = arg(3)] [h:eventPadTriggered = arg(4)] [h:triggerType = arg(5)] [h:assert(triggerType == "pad", "The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: "+triggerType+" to this pad", 0)] [h:switchToken(me)] [h:trapped = if(event=="movedOff" || event=="movedReturn",1,0)] [h:attackRoll = 1d20] [h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity), CODE:{ [h:''] [h:entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)] [h:x = json.get(entryPoint, "x")] [h:y = json.get(entryPoint, "y")] [h:iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)] [h:lastPath = if(trapped, json.get(lastPath, 0, 0), json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1) )] [h, token(padName): setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())] [h: moveToken(x, y)] [h: txtOut = if(trapped,"You failed to climb out
","you've fallen into a pit
")] [h: AgTest = "Failed"] }; { [h:''] [h: txtOut = if(trapped,"You succeed to climb out
", "You nearly fell into a pit, but succeeded your Ag test. Rethink your next move!!
")] [h: AgTest = "Success"] [h:''] [h, if(event == "movedOn"), CODE: { [entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)] [iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)] [edgePoint = json.get(lastPath, iEntryPoint-1)] [lastPath = json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1)] [x = json.get(edgePoint, "x")] [y = json.get(edgePoint, "y")] [moveToken(x, y)] }] }] [h:broadcast(txtOut)] [h:macro.return = lastPath]
Standard Pit.label: Standard Pit

Limit Movement.command:
[h:' '] [h:"toggles) is set to a number other then 0. The below macro handles movement limitation in a very basic form. You can choose to change this to handle more advanced movement limitations. It uses the same scope as the onTokenMove macro, which means that you have certain variables at your disposal: - limitMovement: is the max amount the token is allowed to move. - lastPath: an array of coordinates of the path over which the token has moved - startingLocation: the coordinates where the token started (in the form of an array) - currentLocation: the coordinates where the token ended (in the form of an array) - usedMove: the amount of cells moved (getMoveCount()) An example: Lets say that all the tokens have a characteristic: Dexterity and the max amount of cells a token is allowed to move is 4 x Dexterity. In addition if a token is Dead or Incapacitated, it cannot move. Lets say that these conditions are set with states in your framework. Then you could add this piece of code in front of the if() in the macro. [h,if(getState('Dead') || getState('Incapacitated'), CODE:{ [limitMovement = 0] [message = '%{tok} is incapacitated and cannot move'] }; { [limitMovement = 4*Dexterity] }] -->"] [tok = getSelectedNames()] [if(listCount(tok) > 1), CODE:{ [tok = listGet(tok, 0)] [switchToken(tok)] [initInUse = !json.isEmpty(json.get(getInitiativeList(),"tokens"))] [singleMove = 0] }; { [initInUse = if(getInitiative() != "The token is not in the initiative list.", 1, 0)] [singleMove = 1] }] [h: linkedAreas = getLibProperty("linkedAreas", "lib:EventMacros")] [h,if(json.contains(linkedAreas, map+".W42.Limit")), CODE:{ [thisMapLimits = json.get(linkedAreas, map+".W42.Limit")] [ignoreStartPath = json.remove(lastPath,0)] [thisMapAreas = json.get(getLibProperty("storedAreas","lib:EventMacros"),map)] [DpC = json.get(json.get(getInfo("map"),"grid"),"units per cell")] [h:output = strformat( "MOVE ACTION OF %{token.name}
Areas Checked: %s
Start coord: %{startingLocation}, Current coord: %{currentLocation}
You moved: %{usedMove}

", json.fields(thisMapLimits) )] [foreach(areaName, thisMapLimits,"
"), CODE:{ [h:areaCoords = json.get(thisMapAreas, areaName)] [h:intersectPath = json.intersection(ignoreStartPath,areaCoords)] [h:eventPadTriggered = json.intersection(lastPath,areaCoords)] [h:diffCount = json.length(intersectPath)*DpC] [h:modifier = if(areaName == "Very Difficult Terrain", 2, 1)] [h:totalDiff = diffCount*modifier] [h:usedMove = usedMove + totalDiff] [h:output = output + strformat( "Area: %{areaName} overlap with last path: %{intersectPath}
Trigger Type: %s
You moved %{diffCount} (+%{totalDiff} move) over %{areaName}
", bot_getEventType() )] }] [h:output = output + strformat("In total you moved: %{usedMove}")] [broadcast(output)] }] [message = "You moved %{tok} %{usedMove} cells. The maximum allowed movement is %{limitMovement} cells."] [if( !isGM() && initInUse && usedMove && usedMove > limitMovement), CODE:{ [broadcast(strformat(message))] [tokens.denyMove = 1] [doAbort = 1] [resetMove = 1] [lastPath = "[]"] [if(singleMove): currentLocation = startingLocation] }; {}]
Limit Movement.label: Limit Movement

Standard Net Trap.command:
[h:''] [h:me = arg(0)] [h:event = arg(1)] [h:padName = arg(2)] [h:lastPath = arg(3)] [h:eventPadTriggered = arg(4)] [h:triggerType = arg(5)] [h:netTrapPad = "net trap 1"] [h:assert(triggerType == "pad", "The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: "+triggerType+" to this pad", 0)] [h:switchToken(me)] [h:trapped = if(event=="movedOff" || event=="movedReturn",1,0)] [h:attackRoll = 1d20] [h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity), CODE:{ [h:''] [h:entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)] [h:x = json.get(entryPoint, "x")] [h:y = json.get(entryPoint, "y")] [h:iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)] [h:lastPath = if(trapped, json.get(lastPath, 0, 0), json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1) )] [h, token(netTrapPad): setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())] [h: moveToken(x, y)] [h: txtOut = if(trapped,"You failed to climb out
","you've triggered a net trap
")] [h: AgTest = "Failed"] [h: setState('Trapped', 1, me)] }; { [h:''] [h: txtOut = if(trapped,"You succeed to climb out
", "You nearly triggered a trip wire, but succeeded your Ag test. Rethink your next move!!
")] [h: AgTest = "Success"] [h: setState('Trapped', 0, me)] [h:''] [h, if(event == "movedOn"), CODE: { [entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)] [iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)] [edgePoint = json.get(lastPath, iEntryPoint-1)] [lastPath = json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1)] [x = json.get(edgePoint, "x")] [y = json.get(edgePoint, "y")] [moveToken(x, y)] }] }] [h:broadcast(txtOut)] [h:macro.return = lastPath]
Standard Net Trap.label: Standard Net Trap

Limit Sight.command: [h:''] [h:''] [h:me = arg(0)] [h:event = arg(1)] [h:triggerType = arg(5)] [h:assert(triggerType == "pad" || triggerType == "area", "The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: "+triggerType+" to this pad", 0)] [h:switchToken(me)] [h: sightLevel = getProperty("w42.bot.sightLevel")] [h,if(sightLevel == ""): sightLevel = 0] [h:sightType = getSightType()] [h,if(!startsWith(sightType, "Limited ")):setProperty("w42.bot.oldSightType", sightType)] [h,if(event == "movedOn"): sightLevel = min(4,sightLevel + 1)] [h,if(event == "movedOff"): sightLevel = max(0,sightLevel - 1)] [h:setProperty("w42.bot.sightLevel", sightLevel)] [h, if(sightLevel):setSightType("Limited "+sightLevel); setSightType(getProperty("w42.bot.oldSightType"))]
Limit Sight.label: Limit Sight

InterTel Msg.command:
[h:varsFromStrProp(arg(0))]
[h:bot_animateText(tok+" is being teleported from "+oldMap+" to "+newMap,"Inter map teleport", 0,"default","300","50")]

macros.label: Limit Sight
macros.command: [h:''] [h:''] [h:me = arg(0)] [h:event = arg(1)] [h:triggerType = arg(5)] [h:assert(triggerType == "pad" || triggerType == "area", "The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: "+triggerType+" to this pad", 0)] [h:switchToken(me)] [h: sightLevel = getProperty("w42.bot.sightLevel")] [h,if(sightLevel == ""): sightLevel = 0] [h:sightType = getSightType()] [h,if(!startsWith(sightType, "Limited ")):setProperty("w42.bot.oldSightType", sightType)] [h,if(event == "movedOn"): sightLevel = min(4,sightLevel + 1)] [h,if(event == "movedOff"): sightLevel = max(0,sightLevel - 1)] [h:setProperty("w42.bot.sightLevel", sightLevel)] [h, if(sightLevel):setSightType("Limited "+sightLevel); setSightType(getProperty("w42.bot.oldSightType"))]

macros.label: Limit Movement
macros.command:
[h:' '] [h:"toggles) is set to a number other then 0. The below macro handles movement limitation in a very basic form. You can choose to change this to handle more advanced movement limitations. It uses the same scope as the onTokenMove macro, which means that you have certain variables at your disposal: - limitMovement: is the max amount the token is allowed to move. - lastPath: an array of coordinates of the path over which the token has moved - startingLocation: the coordinates where the token started (in the form of an array) - currentLocation: the coordinates where the token ended (in the form of an array) - usedMove: the amount of units (distance per cell, e.g. feet or meters) moved (getMoveCount()) Note that the actual movement limitation kicks in when: 1. the initiative panel is active and the token is part of it 2. a PLAYER moves the token 3. the space the token is moved is more then its property 'movement' (edit token to change it) 4. An example: Lets say that all the tokens have a characteristic: Dexterity and the max amount of units a token is allowed to move is 4 x Dexterity. In addition if a token is Dead or Incapacitated, it cannot move. Lets say that these conditions are set with states in your framework. Then you could add this piece of code in front of the if() in the macro. [h,if(getState('Dead') || getState('Incapacitated'), CODE:{ [limitMovement = 0] [message = '%{tok} is incapacitated and cannot move.
'] }; { [limitMovement = getProperty('Speed')] }] -->"] [h:toggles = getLibProperty("toggles", "lib:EventMacros")] [h:varsFromStrProp(toggles)] [h:tok = getSelectedNames()] [h,if(getState('Dead')), CODE:{ [limitMovement = 0] [message = strformat("%{tok} is incapacitated and cannot move.
")] }; { [message = ""] [if(!isNumber(limitMovement)): limitMovement = getProperty(limitMovement)] [if(limitMovement == ""): limitMovement = 0] }] [if(listCount(tok) > 1), CODE:{ [tok = listGet(tok, 0)] [switchToken(tok)] [initInUse = !json.isEmpty(json.get(getInitiativeList(),"tokens"))] [singleMove = 0] }; { [initInUse = if(getInitiative() != "The token is not in the initiative list.", 1, 0)] [singleMove = 1] }] [h: linkedAreas = getLibProperty("linkedAreas", "lib:EventMacros")] [h,if(json.contains(linkedAreas, map+".W42.Limit")), CODE:{ [thisMapLimits = json.get(linkedAreas, map+".W42.Limit")] [ignoreStartPath = json.remove(lastPath,0)] [thisMapAreas = json.get(getLibProperty("storedAreas","lib:EventMacros"),map)] [DpC = json.get(json.get(getInfo("map"),"grid"),"units per cell")] [output = strformat( "MOVE ACTION OF %{token.name}
Max allowed move is: "+limitMovement+"
Areas Checked: %s
Start coord: %{startingLocation}, Current coord: %{currentLocation}
You moved: %{usedMove}

", json.fields(thisMapLimits) )] [foreach(areaName, thisMapLimits,"
"), CODE:{ [h:areaCoords = json.get(thisMapAreas, areaName)] [h:intersectPath = json.intersection(ignoreStartPath,areaCoords)] [h:eventPadTriggered = json.intersection(lastPath,areaCoords)] [h:diffCount = json.length(intersectPath)*DpC] [h:modifier = if(areaName == "Very Difficult Terrain", 2, 1)] [h:totalDiff = diffCount*modifier] [h:usedMove = usedMove + totalDiff] [h:output = output + strformat( "Area: %{areaName} overlap with last path: %{intersectPath}
Trigger Type: %s
You moved %{diffCount} (+%{totalDiff} move) over %{areaName}
", bot_getEventType() )] }] [output = output + strformat("In total you moved: %{usedMove}")] [broadcast(output)] }] [h:'pause("initInUse", "tmp", "usedMove" , "usedMove" ,"limitMovement")'] [h,if( !isGM() && initInUse && usedMove && usedMove > limitMovement), CODE:{ [broadcast(strformat("%{message}You moved %{tok} %{usedMove} units. The maximum allowed movement is %{limitMovement} units."))] [tokens.denyMove = 1] [doAbort = 1] [resetMove = 1] [lastPath = "[]"] [if(singleMove): currentLocation = startingLocation] }; {}]

macros.label: Standard Trap
macros.command:
[h:''] [h:me = arg(0)] [h:event = arg(1)] [h:triggerType = arg(5)] [h:assert(triggerType == "pad" || triggerType == "area", "The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: "+triggerType+" to this pad", 0)] [h:switchToken(me)] [h:attackRoll = d20] [h:roll=1d6] [h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity):HP=HP-roll] [h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity):broadcast("You have triggered a trap and sustained "+roll+" hits.
")]

macros.label: Standard Net Trap
macros.command:
[h:''] [h:me = arg(0)] [h:event = arg(1)] [h:padName = arg(2)] [h:lastPath = arg(3)] [h:eventPadTriggered = arg(4)] [h:triggerType = arg(5)] [h:netTrapPad = "net trap 1"] [h:assert(triggerType == "pad", "The GM has assigned a wrong trigger type: "+triggerType+" to this pad", 0)] [h:switchToken(me)] [h:trapped = if(event=="movedOff" || event=="movedReturn",1,0)] [h:attackRoll = 1d20] [h,if(attackRoll > Dexterity), CODE:{ [h:''] [h:entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)] [h:x = json.get(entryPoint, "x")] [h:y = json.get(entryPoint, "y")] [h:iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)] [h:lastPath = if(trapped, json.get(lastPath, 0, 0), json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1) )] [h, token(netTrapPad): setTokenImage(getTokenHandout())] [h: moveToken(x, y)] [h: txtOut = if(trapped,"You failed to climb out
","you've triggered a net trap
")] [h: AgTest = "Failed"] [h: setState('Trapped', 1, me)] }; { [h:''] [h: txtOut = if(trapped,"You succeed to climb out
", "You nearly triggered a trip wire, but succeeded your Ag test. Rethink your next move!!
")] [h: AgTest = "Success"] [h: setState('Trapped', 0, me)] [h:''] [h, if(event == "movedOn"), CODE: { [entryPoint = json.get(eventPadTriggered, 0)] [iEntryPoint = json.indexOf (lastPath, entryPoint)] [edgePoint = json.get(lastPath, iEntryPoint-1)] [lastPath = json.get(lastPath, 0, iEntryPoint-1)] [x = json.get(edgePoint, "x")] [y = json.get(edgePoint, "y")] [moveToken(x, y)] }] }] [h:broadcast(txtOut)] [h:macro.return = lastPath]

macros.label: Excl FoW Maps
macros.command:
[h:'<!-- 
	this macro will turn off reset FoW for the maps that are listed here 
	So IF restore FoW is turned ON in the settings then it will NOT restore
	the FoW on the map BASE in this example. Thus you can change or add 
	"BASE" to e.g. "Dungeon level 1, Forest of Dreadfull things, etc.".
	The listed maps will be excluded.
	
	Alternatively (if you like) you can also turn it around and set 
	doResetFoW = 1 and turn it OFF in the settings. In that case this macro
	will work in reverse
-->']

[h, if(listContains("BASE", getCurrentMapName())): doResetFoW = 0]

48.gmnotes:
Click "onCampaignLoad" to activate automatic stair and doors transitions! 
(Teleports, InterTeleports and the one way teleports)
The onCampaignLoad button can be found on the 'selection panel'

When the animation of the doors stop working and start to create all kinds of duplicates, then the autoexec on the other clients doesn't work anymore. This usually happens when the ownership of this tokens has been assigned to someone not online. Make sure NO OWNERS ARE SET FOR THIS LIB:TOKEN

am.bot.disguiseMacro.label: Use Disguise
am.bot.disguiseMacro.tooltip:
- Clicking the Use Disguise button will add the current token image to your disguise list.
- Changing your image and clicking the button again will add a new image to list.
OR
- Selecting image:tokens together with the token will add those images to the disguise
list of the token

- A list will be shown for all the possible images you have loaded.
- You have the option to Change or Delete an image from your list.
- On the lib file, if you click autoDisguiseButton a text box will appear with a token
property you can add to your Campaign Property token properties to automatically add the
Use Disguise button to tokens.

bot.fg.Animations.Description: Full functionality to setup animated doors, both single and double, both rotating and sliding. Including support to activate them in at least 5 different ways.

Toggling (open or close) an animated door will give the following options: look through key-hole, look through window, crack door open, open door half way, open door fully. The VBL will be adjusted accordingly

Set up a door with a switch token that corresponds with that door when you click on the switch. Option for the gm to 'Lock' the door, so players can't open it. You can also set a proximity check, that checks whether a token of the player is close enough to open the door.
A macro and macro button with which you can animate the movement of one or more tokens. See video
Same as the macro only in the form of a macro function that you can call inside your own macros.
A macro that generates an input screen where you can setup the animated text. This will pop up a frame on every client pc showing a frame where a delayed text is printed in
Same as the macro only in the form of a macro function that you can call inside your own macros.
Use lastpath of selected token to run a screen animation
Link the view animation of selected tokens and store it on one token
Run view animation created for selected token

bot.fg.EventTokenArea.Description: (Roof) When a token moves onto a building (with a roof) the roof automatically turns transparent (with a red halo) and return opague again when the token moves away from it. For this to work you will need to install the tabel into your framework inside the attached zip file.

in addition to existing Roof swap function, an option is added where you can store the VBL currently on a building and swap it with a VBL cross shape. Hence from the outside players can see the partially and as soon as they enter the building the VBL of the roof is swapped with the VBL of the building.

(Roof) Roofs have now a corresponding 'set roof' macro with which you can assign doors to the roof. If doors are assigned, the Roof automatically becomes a 'warded' area, which you can ONLY enter through the OPEN door. Thus if the door is closed, there is no way a player can move her token onto the roof. If the door is open, a player can ONLY move in the building when it moves her token OVER the door token first.

(Foliage) Tokens with these names work exactly as roofs, except there will be NO red halo outline for the transparent version AND you can choose to use a different picture to swap with when you move over it. (on default when you move over them their image is swapped with an transparent image from the tables).
(Canopy) Tokens with these names are automatically given an treetrunk as alternative image when a token moves over them.
(Ward) Tokens that move onto this area are moved back to their original position. They cannot enter the area.

(EventPad) These tokens are triggered on certain event e.g. when a token move onto the pad. These events can be set through a 'set event pad' macro. These pads replace the former Pit and Trap pads and allow for a much more versatile use. When the pad is triggered then a macro that you linked to it will run. Extra example is added: trip wire in combination with a net trap (thnx Pinkrose)

(Canopy, Foliage, Roof) Linked tokens are special pads that are activated simultaneously. If you have two or more tokens that are linked by the same link identifier, e.g. 'Linked 1 Roof 5' and 'Linked 1 Canopy 3' (here the link identifier is '1'), then when one of the tokens is activated (by moving a token on top of it) the other is activated as well.

(i.c.w. Canopy, Foliage, Roof) Bridges are pads that you link with Canopy, Foliage or Roof pads. When you move over a Bridge and then onto a Roof (in one move) then the roof does NOT dissapear (See vid. tutorial for more info).

(i.c.w. Canopy, Foliage, Roof) Tunnels work exactly the same as Bridges albeith the opposite effect. So when moving over a tunnel token the roofs disappear, while moving directly onto a roof they won't.

(ShadowPads ) This allows to watch token movement on map A from map B. Typical use is a 2 story building where you can watch the ground floor from the first floor through a gap in the floor (and vice versa). See vid tutorial for more details.

bot.fg.EventTokenArea.Dependencies: State: Special Area; Token: Area Marker
bot.fg.EventTokenArea.Macro_Group: OnTokenMove; Pad Macros; Teleport &Roof; Event Area Macros
bot.fg.EventTokenArea.Description:
These are Areas you can define (and these can take ANY form, with a resolution of the grid) and depending whether a token moves onto, over, off, etc. it will trigger an event (macro). The best use for these are to define difficult terrain areas which impede the movement of a token. For which the 'Limit Movement' macro in the lib:EventMacros lib is now adapted.
Finally one other good thing of these areas: they're FAST! A lot faster then the token method currently in use.

bot.fg.Functions.Macro_Group: Geofunctions Support; Geofunctions; Util - Math; Message; Util - General; Util - Documented

bot.fg.MapCreation.Description: Select one or more tokens, set an area and a number and copies of the tokens will be randomly scattered accross the preset area. Ideal for e.g. rocks, trees, or a chaos warband.
A macro to build a big forest FAST and have it ready for the Canopy 'Trick'. This is a specialized macro based on the 'Scatter' macro
A macro with which you can summon tokens from the 'BASE' map onto the current.map . The location you can set by hand or you can summon it onto a selected token.
A macro that with which you can quickly fill an area with tokens (also useful for creating special areas).
With this panel you can edit the draw order of the selected tokens, rotate them individually, random or as a group. It also contains layer and shape dropdown list.
An new set of macros that allows you to fill a e.g. Town square with tokens (forming a crowd), which can then 'flee in panic' when the fight goes down.
Two new macro to create a field on the map where its VERY easy to place token, used for map creation. Try it out for more info.

bot.fg.Other.Description: To use with 'Always on Top' application. With this feature you can force a client slave to have the same button selected as you have on the master. Read the manual for more info. Usefull for those that like to use Full Screen Mode but still have a chat window and macros available. (and working)

bot.fg.Other.Function: Load Map and Coordinates on Start Up
bot.fg.Other.Description: This feature can be found in the settings, where you can set the map to load on start-up and the coordinates (or token name) on that map to go to.
Teleport pads that are linked to a specific token, can be used for a mass invasion!
Same as the macro menu but now on the fly.

bot.fg.Tables.Description: This macro opens a form in which you can copy paste a table straight from excel. Beneath it you can set the title of the table. The checkbox enables you to view the table afterwards and edit it. This is NOT a maptool table but a Bag of Tricks table. It will be stored on lib:EventMacros. The advantage is that its dynamic and it allows multiple columns.
This macro shows you a list of available tables. The one you pick is shown in a form in which you can edit the values.
This macro shows you a list of available 'Bag of Tricks' tables that you created using 'Create Table'. The one you pick is will be deleted from lib:EventMacros

With this function you can retrieve a value from the stored BoT Tables. Usage: bot_table('name of table', optional: 'column', 'row', ). Both 'column' and 'row' can either be an index number or the name of the row/column. Leaving them empty will result in a random choice.
Returns a list with the stored BoT Tables.
Returns a list with the stored Maptool Tables.
Returns the row names of the given BoT table
Returns the column names of the given BoT table

bot.fg.Transportation.Description: (PadStart, PadEnd) every teleport consists out of a starting pad and ending pad (paired pads), if you drop a token on one it will end on the other. You can resize or place them anyway you want, as long as its on the same map.

(Interpad) Any Interpad is automatically paired with the Interpad with the SAME identifier (e.g. '1') on a DIFFERENT map. Again, size and place are completely free, as long as its on two different maps.

(PadJump, PadDrop, InterJump and InterDrop) Moving onto a 'Jump' token will transport you its paired 'drop' token. And NOT the other way round. The 'Inter' version can be used for transport between maps.

(PadJumpBorder, PadDropBorder, InterJumpBorder and InterDropBorder) As with the one way teleports The big difference with the 'normal one way teleports' is that the 'border teleport' tokens will teleport a token that moves onto OR OVER the special pad. I've added 8 new tokens to the zip file (4 horizontal and 4 vertical as you must NOT rotate the tokens, because the footprint of the token does NOT rotate).
The inter versions can ideally be used for e.g. large maps where you can build seperate sections on seperate MT maps. This will keep the memory use per map low and will give an easy transfer between to sections.
The map versions can be used for creating e.g. a closed loop map where the edges of the map are connected. Moving over the edge will automatically transport you to the opposite edge.
(InterPadBorder, PadStartBorder, PadEndBorder) Same as the above one way, but now also two ways teleports.

(MappedPad) These pads work similar to the teleport pads, although of these there is only one type of pad and not two like the start and end pad with the 'normal' teleports. When initializing them you'll get a pop-up per map where they exist and here you can set the destination pad. The 'destination' must be a number, so you can if you like also put in forumulas or dice rolls, as long as the result is a number (and as long as a destination pad with that number actually exist).

bot.fg.UtilityGeneral.Description: A macro whith which you can easily set lights sources on tokens

A frame where you can set a pool of dice that you can roll in one click. I have used Rumbles code and layout as a basis and rewrote most of it. Noteably I've added 'options' so you can fully customize the frame.
A macro that forces a pop-up on ALL clients showing a token handout (gm only).
A macro that forces ALL clients and selected tokens to the chosen map AND forces all views to the centreOnMePad (if its on the map)(gm only).

A utility that scans ALL maps and ALL tokens returning a list of all tokens that match the search string. Updated with a wide variety of options, biggest change is showing the results as macro links which allows you to either Copy, Move or Select the token.
A macro that shows all kinds of debug info (primarily for tracking variable values), with several optional settings.
A macro that allows you to add extra token images to a token, so you can e.g. 'polymorph' during gameplay into something else.

A frame where you can whisper (with some text formats) to one or more players without needing to use the /w option. It also includes an impersonation feature so you can speak as another token, without needing to actually impersonate it.
A macro that allows you to copy/paste/delete macros from/on a selected token onto another token.
A macro that allows you to create and store messages for players.
A macro that links an lib:EventMacro macro to a token. When the token is selected, the macro is activated. Usefull for e.g. switching maps.
A macro specially developed for macro developers. It can be used to discern the execution time for a certain macro.

A macro that checks ALL maps and ALL (lib)tokens for potential issues. It checks whether token names contain non-alphanumerical characters and checks the libs for the same and owner ship and visibility. Any errors are rendered in a frame with hyperlinks that lead you to the token.
A macro that detects and cleans up characters in token names that are incompatible with the macro system in maptool.
A macro with which you can easily create the code for a complex input string.
Two macro functions that allow you to show fancy frames around the 'frames' you usually show to the players.

The Room Description token allows you to easily access a description of the area where the players are AND to easily share texts (e.g. pieces or parchments, treasure etc) and images (of e.g. encounters) with them in one overview

bot.fg.UtilityMove.Description: Create groups of tokens. When you select one token of the group, all the tokens are automatically selected.
You can combine tokens into one group. When you move ONE token of that group then the whole group moves accordingly.

When the group is defined you can use the CW or CCW rotation buttons to rotate the group. For snapped tokens the increment is 90, for unsnapped its 45 and its also possible to select a token from the group and set its facing and then click either CW or CCW, after which the group will be rotated to that direction (unsnapped only).
For defined groups (or a group of selected tokens) you can set different formation like, square, wedge, line, echelon, spread and compact.
A toggle in the settings where you can turn on continuous centre on token. This will force a centre on map for every token moved. (only works for single token move).

When a player moves a token all the FoW will be restored and only the PC visible areas will be cleared. This function has the extra advantage that the VBL lag bug (game gets very laggy after a while when there is a lot of VBL on the map) is ommitted.

This function is created by Aliasmask. It can also be found on his lib:Players. However to make both libs compatible I've added it to the BoT so it can be turned off on lib:Players. This function checks EVERY step of the just-moved-token and checks whether it can see into gridcell its moving into. If not then the movement is halted. This function too has the extra advantage that the VBL lag bug is ommitted.

bot.fg.UtilityMove.Dependencies: State: pathFeet; Token: red feet, blue feet
bot.fg.UtilityMove.Description: Added toggle to the settings where you can turn on path tracking. This will show small feet in the grid cells where the last token moved. Red for NPCs and blue for PCs.
This is a toggle on the macro panel that will lock down the movement of ALL tokens. Only the gm can move the tokens now. To use simply hit the macro button and hit it again to allow movement again.

Similar to lock movement, only this works on the individual token. It prevents the token from being moved. Both by player and gm! To use: select one or more token. Click the 'lock token' macro. There is a general toggle in the settings to turn this feature on and off.

This functions can be turned of or on the in the settings-->toggle tab. It uses visible to owner only function. When a token is invisible this setting is (automatically) turned on. Any token that has Purge invisibility turned on will be added as owner to the invisible when the invisible token is in range. See manual for full instructions.

bot.fg.VBL.Description: With this macro you can add a VBL layer upon a token that 'moves' with the token. (Its not really ON the token, but erased and redrawn as you move the token). Possible VBL are Square, Rectangle, Line, Regular Polygon. With a bunch of extra options (like offset, scale, fill, etc.).

In addition to the 'normal' stamps, you can now also save ANY VBL currently over the token as a stamp. So you can draw VBL over a token as you normally draw VBL and the store that VBL as a stamp onto the token. This is particularly usefull for dungeon tiles where you can store the VBL data onto the tile and then copy paste the tile over the map.

This function will draw VBL on ALL tokens that match a (partial) search string. Its mainly intended for roofs and canopy but options (selection, all, layers) have been added to use it for other purposes. This macro also contains 2 different scaling techniques to apply the VBL onto the token. Finally you can also store the ENTIRE VBL structure and you can use Toggle VBL to turn that on or off
This function corresponds with Mass VBL. In Mass VBL you can store all the added VBL and with this function you can turn it on or off instantly.
This function will erase ALL VBL in a given radius (in grid cells) around one or more selected tokens.

properties.bot.fg.diagLists: diagStateList=the switch buttons to operate doors, doors so the gm can lock them (doors will NOT work without this state), path tracking (blue and red feet), creating special areas (like movement limitation), used for the Crowd utility, used for Map Editor Utility ; diagTokenList=the switch buttons to operate doors, path tracking (the PC track), path tracking (the NPC track), creating special areas (like movement limitation), the transparent field tokens required for the Map Editor, a token required as placeholder when using the Embarkation macros (vehicles) ; diagTableList=Roofs - Formations - Dicebox - Room Descriptions, Aliasmask Polymorph (table is only necessary if you want to access images from that table), Nildiks Room Description  (table is only necessary if you want to access images from that table), Nildiks Fancy Frames and Room Description
properties.bot.fg.menuMacroList: utilAnimationList=Door, Doors, Lock, ClearSound, MoveCrowd, MoveCrowdP, MoveToken, AnimateText, runAnimateView, ResetPit, UnShowAreaUtil, ExecuteEvent, ExecAssignpad ; utilUtilList=DiceBox, SwitchMap, SeekToken, SetLightSource, UseDisguise, ToggleSpecial, ShowHandout, WhisperFrame, MessageMngr, SetDrawOrder, GroupMove, UngroupMove, Formations, ActivateGroup, GroupSelect, UngroupSelect, toggleEmbark, SummonTokens, ToggleVBL, VBLGrenade, LockMovement, LockToken, moveEventToggle, ShowDescription ; utilInvisList=StartInvis, EndInvis, SeeInvis, SawInvis, PurgeInvis, PurgedInvis, AnulInvis, AnulledInvis, resetRanges, changeElevation ; basicsList=Settings, BoTFeatures, InitializePads, AltInitPads, Manual ; animationList=SetDoor, SetRoof, setAnimateView, linkViewAnim, ActivateSwitches ; soundList=ClearSound, ReplaceSoundURL, SetSound ; scatterList=BuildForest, ChooseTrunks, CreateCrowd, ChooseCrowd, ScatterTokens, MassVBL ; eventList=DrawArea, SetEventPad, FillArea, ResetPit, DefineArea, SetEventButton, AssignArea, UnShowArea ; assignList=AssignTokens, Execute ; tablesList=CreateTable, ShowTable, DeleteTable, CreateMTTable ; mapList=MapEditor, QuitMapEditor, MovetoHidden, MovetoToken ; utilsList=SeekToken, SetLightSource, SetReference, Remove20, SetDrawOrder, RenumberTokens, ToggleSpecial, SetTokenSize, CopyDelMacros, PasteMacros, UndoDelMacros, FindDuplicates, embarkation, PadExplorer, AutoDisguiseBttn, SetVBLStamp, MassVBL, ToggleVBL, Deleteprops, Benchmark, DiagnoseMaps, CleanTokNames, roomDescrHelp

[h:'<!-- defineFunction(function, macro, ignoreOutput, newScope) -->']

[h:'<!-- REDEFINED FUNCTIONS -->']
<!-- isdefined: 0 no, 1 yes, 2 mt core function -->
[h,if(getLibProperty('fullScreenBroadcast','lib:EventMacros') == 1 && isFunctionDefined("broadcast") == 2):defineFunction("broadcast", "bot_broadcast@"+thisLib, 1, 1 ) ]

[H: '<!------------------------------------------------------- ASSERTIONS, check if settings are set up correctly -->']
[h:baseMap		= getLibProperty("baseMapName", "lib:EventMacros")]
[h:mapList		= getAllMapNames("json")]
[h,if(!json.contains(mapList, baseMap)), CODE:{
	<!-- if this is the first time someone sets up then run the feature installation window. Check if your on the right map, lib eventmacros is there, settings is run once -->
	[firstTimeUse	= 1]
	[macro("welcomeInit@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
	[botTok	= findToken("lib:OnTokenMove")]
	[emTok	= findToken("lib:EventMacros")]
	[assert(botTok != "", "BASE map name is not set up correctly. Please run Settings and set up the correct BASE map, when done run onCampaignLoad macro on the lib:OnTokenMove token",0)]
	[assert(emTok != "", "Make sure that there is a lib:EventMacros on the same map as lib:OnTokenMove and that you have run the settings (and set up the BASE map correctly in the settings)",0)]
	[setLibProperty("baseMapName", getCurrentMapName(), "lib:EventMacros")]
	[baseMap		= getLibProperty("baseMapName", "lib:EventMacros")]
};{
	[firstTimeUse	= 0]
}]

[H: '<!------------------------------------------------------- Check if list of logged on GMs has changed -->']
[h:newGmNames = getLibProperty("gmNames", "lib:EventMacros")]
[h,if(json.type(newGmNames)!="ARRAY"):newGmNames	= "[]"]
[h:oldgmNames = newGmNames]
[H:playerName = json.fromList(getPlayerName())]
[h:tmpAllPlayers = getAllPlayerNames("json")]
[H,if(isGM()), CODE:{
	[newGmNames	= json.union(newGmNames,playerName)]
	[intersect	= '[]']
}; { 
	[intersect	= json.intersection(newGmNames,playerName)]
	[if(!json.isEmpty(intersect)): newGmNames = json.difference(newGmNames,playerName)]
}]
[H: newGmNames = json.intersection(tmpAllPlayers,newGmNames)]

[H: '<!------------------------------------------------------- if the list has changed, make sure you do the update on the BASE map!! -->']
[h:oldMap			= getCurrentMapName()]
[h,if(!json.equals(oldgmNames,newGmNames)), CODE:{
	[if(!firstTimeUse):setCurrentMap(baseMap)]
 	[setLibProperty("gmNames",newGmNames, "lib:EventMacros")]
}; {}]

[h:noGM = json.isEmpty(getLibProperty("gmNames", "lib:EventMacros"))]
[h,if(noGM), CODE:{
	[abort(input(
		"junk|<html><b>The system has no GMs registered.<br>If you started the game without a gm restart it and correct it.<br>Else pick the gm from the list below</b></html>|-|LABEL|SPAN=TRUE",
		"gmNames|"+getAllPlayerNames()+"|Select the gm|LIST|SELECT=0 VALUE=STRING"
	))]
	[setLibProperty("gmNames", json.fromList(gmNames), "lib:EventMacros")]
}]

[H: '<!-- ----------------------------------------------------- /Check if list of logged on GMs has changed -->']

[h:'<!-- ------------------- check for areas, if theyre not initialized do so now ------------------------>']
[h: linkedAreas = getLibProperty("linkedAreas", "Lib:EventMacros") ]
[h, if(json.type(linkedAreas)=="UNKNOWN"): setLibProperty("linkedAreas", "{}", "Lib:EventMacros")]

[h:'<!-- ------------------ if the maps are not initialized, do so now ----------------------------------->']
[h:oldMapsPads		= getLibProperty("allMapsPads", "lib:EventMacros")]
[h:initialized		= 1]
[h:chckMapsOCL		= getLibProperty("checkMapsOCL", "lib:EventMacros")]
[h:macroLocation	= getMacroLocation()]

[h, if(json.type(oldMapsPads)=='OBJECT' && chckMapsOCL), CODE:{
	[excludedMaps	= getLibProperty("excludedMaps","lib:EventMacros")]
	[toCheckMaps	= json.difference(mapList, excludedMaps)]
	[foreach(currentMap, mapList,""), CODE:{
		[setCurrentMap(currentMap)]
		<!-- find the map on which the lib token is located -->
		[if(findToken(macroLocation) != ""): macroMap = currentMap]
		<!-- check if map is initialized -->
		[if(!json.contains(oldMapsPads, currentMap) && json.contains(toCheckMaps, currentMap)):initialized = 0]<br>
	}]
}; {}]

[h, if(json.type(oldMapsPads)!='OBJECT' && chckMapsOCL), CODE:{
	[initialized	= 0]
	[foreach(currentMap, mapList,""), CODE:{
		[setCurrentMap(currentMap)]
		[if(findToken(macroLocation) != ""): macroMap = currentMap]
	}]
}; {}]

[r,if(!initialized && chckMapsOCL), CODE:{
	[r:bot_initializePads(1)]
	[h:newMapsPads = macro.return]
	[h:setCurrentMap(macroMap)]
	[h:setLibProperty("allMapsPads",newMapsPads,"lib:EventMacros")]
}; {}]

[h,if(getLibProperty('runSwitchForm','lib:EventMacros')==1), CODE:{
	[macro("SwitchFrame@Lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
}; {}]

<!-- AMs disguise macro initialization -->
[H: disguiseMacro	= getLibProperty("am.bot.disguiseMacro")]
[H, if(json.isEmpty(disguiseMacro)), CODE: {
	[macroName	= "Use Disguise"]
	[index		= getMacroIndexes(macroName)]
	[command	= getMacroCommand(index)]
	[props		= json.set(getMacroProps(index,"json"),"command",command)]
	[props		= json.removeAll(props,json.set("{}","index","","group",""))]
	[setLibProperty("am.bot.disguiseMacro",props)]
};{}]

[h:disableOCLCheck		= getLibProperty('disableOCLCheck','lib:EventMacros')]
[h,if(disableOCLCheck != 1), CODE:{
	[h:'<!-- -------------------------------- OUTPUT TO CHAT THROUGH BROADCAST -------------------------------- -->']
	
	[h: info		= getInfo("client")]
	[h: assert(json.type(info)== "OBJECT", "MAKE SURE THAT THE LIB TOKENS ARE ON THE TOKEN LAYER. After that, save and reload the campaign file.",0)]
	[h: libs		= json.get(info, "library tokens")]
	[h: botVersion	= json.get(libs, "lib:OnTokenMove")]
	[h: assert(listContains(json.fields(libs), "Lib:EventMacros"), "Lib:EventMacros not found! Make sure that its in the campaign file, and then save and reload the campaign file",0)]
	[h: mtVersion	= json.get(info, "version")]
	[h,if(indexOf(mtVersion, "b") != -1): 
		mtVersionNr	= substring(mtVersion, indexOf(mtVersion,"b")+1,indexOf(mtVersion,"b")+3)
	;
		mtVersionNr	= substring(mtVersion, 2,3)
	]

<!-- too often this renders an error so removing it for now -->
[mtVersionNr = 4]

	<!-- check for installation errors and sets the messages error messages - NO NEW SCOPE
	stateOutput, tokOutput, tableOutput, libOwnerOutput	-->
	[h, if(!firstTimeUse):bot_diagnose(1)]
	[vblSupport		= if(bot_inStr(lower(mtVersion), "nerps") || mtVersionNr > 89 || mtVersionNr == 4, 1, 0)]
	[vblSupport = if(bot_inStr(lower(mtVersion), "nerps") || mtVersionNr > 89 || mtVersionNr >= 4, 1, 0)]
	[vblOutput		= if(vblSupport, "v This Maptool version <b>supports</b> automatic vision blocking manipulation, this functionality will be <b>enabled</b>", "x This Maptool version <b>does <u><font color='red'>not</font></u> support</b> automatic vision blocking manipulation, this functionality will be <b>disabled</b>"))]
	[setLibProperty('vblSupport',vblSupport,'lib:EventMacros')]
	[message		= "v Current online GM's are: <b>"+json.toList(newGmNames) + "</b>"]
	[message		= listAppend(message, "v This campaign runs in Maptool version <b>"+mtVersion+"</b>","<br>")]
	[message		= listAppend(message, "v This campaign is powered by version <b>"+botVersion+"</b> of the <b>Bag of Tricks</b> (<font color='blue'><a href='https://forums.rptools.net/viewtopic.php?f=46&t=28409&p=274496#p274496'>check for updates</a></font>)","<br>")]
	[message		= listAppend(message, vblOutput,"<br>")]
	[h, if(!firstTimeUse), CODE:{
		[message		= listAppend(message, stateOutput,"<br>")]
		[message		= listAppend(message, invisOutput,"<br>")]
		[message		= listAppend(message, tokOutput,"<br>")]
		[message		= listAppend(message, tableOutput,"<br>")]
		[message		= listAppend(message, libOwnerOutput,"<br>")]
		[message		= listAppend(message, togglesOutput,"<br>")]
	};{
		[right			= ""]
		[wrong			= ""]
	}]
	
	[if(right != ""): message = replace(message, "v ", right+"")]
	[if(wrong != ""): message = replace(message, "x ", wrong+"")]

	<!-- 0:message, OPTIONAL1:headertxt, 2:color (bgcolor-txtcolor), 3:userList, 4:token, 5:target6:broadcast-->
	[bot_message(message, "<b>Bag of Tricks - OnCampaignLoad checks</b>", "maroon-yellow", bot_self())]

	[broadcast("
		<table  cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'  bgcolor='blue'>
			<tr>
				<td cellpadding='10' >
					<span title='This open TWO manuals of the BoT' style='text-decoration:none; color:yellow;'>
						" + 
						macroLink('Open BoT Manual', 'manualText@lib:OnTokenMove','self')
						+ "
					</span>
				</td>
			</tr>
		</table>
	","self")] 
};{}]

<!-- ---------------------- on campaign load goto map and coords settings, must come AFTER diagnose due to the map switching -------------------------------------------------------- -->
[h,if(getLibProperty('useStartUpMap','lib:EventMacros')==1), CODE:{
	[if(!firstTimeUse):setCurrentMap(getLibProperty('startUpMap','lib:EventMacros'))]
	[gotoCoord	= getLibProperty('startUpCoords','lib:EventMacros')]
	[h,if(findToken("centreOnMePad") != "" && getLibProperty('useCentreOnMePad','lib:EventMacros')==1), CODE:{
		<!-- if centreOnMePad checkbox is checked AND the token is on the map, centre the map on there -->
		[goto(getTokenX(0,"centreOnMePad"),getTokenY(0,"centreOnMePad"))]
	}; {
		<!-- else centre the map on the given coords -->
		<!-- you can set either a coordinate e.g. 4,5 or a token name e.g. "Nihilus Faine" -->
		[if(listCount(gotoCoord)==2): goto(listGet(gotoCoord, 0),listGet(gotoCoord, 1)) ; goto(gotoCoord)]
	}]
}; {
	[setCurrentMap(oldMap)]
}]

<!-- make sure there is no output to chat -->
[abort(0)]

macros.label: (Un)Show Area
macros.command: [h,macro("showArea@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This macro shows predefined areas by putting token in the cells that are part of the Area.
When you run this macro again the tokens are removed again.

Hence this macro can be used to change pre defined area. To do this first run this macro
for the area you wish to change. The map will then be filled with tokens. Then move these
tokens around, delete them, copy them until youre happy. Then run Define Area and
enter a name for the new Area (can be the same as the original in which case it will be
overwritten) and click ok. A new Area is now defined. Finally you can run Show Area again
to remove the tokens. Note that is you created new tokens that these will NOT be removed by
this macro.

macros.label: <i>Animate Text
macros.command: [h,macro("animateTextInput@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]

macros.label: <image src=" asset://3fcd87c798fedd3ade1bd9ed272550e0"></image>
macros.command: [macro("showDescription@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]

macros.label: Activate Group
macros.command: [h, macro("openGroupFrame@Lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This opens a 'group select' frame which is required for the 'Select Group' to function.
When this panel is closed you can still group and ungroup, but the 'auto select' will only
work when this frame is active.

macros.label: Activate Switches
macros.command: [h, macro("openFrame@Lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This macro activates a frame. As long as that frame is open the following functions are active:
- Door Switches (user can click them to open doors)
- Event Buttons (user can click them to activate linked macro)
- Full screen mode (if turned on in the settings, frames are automatically turned into Dialogs)
- Group select tokens (user can select one token and the rest is auto-selected)
- Force token selection (token that gm selects on his client is also selected on a player client)

macros.label: Alt. Init. Pads
macros.command: [r:bot_altInitMap()]

macros.label: Animate Move
macros.command: [r:bot_animateMove()]

macros.label: Assign Areas
macros.command: [h,macro("assignArea@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
With this macro you can link predefined Areas to Event Macros and to the Limit Movement macro
The Event Macro will be triggered when a token moves over the Area. The handling of this is left
to the macro itself

macros.label: Assign Tokens to Pads
macros.command: [h:bot_assignPads()]
macros.tooltip:
With this macro you can assign token that are on the TOKEN or HIDDEN layer to Assignpads.
Tokens assigned to Assignpads will be moved onto their assigned pad when you run Execute
Assignpads

macros.label: Auto Disguise Btn
macros.tooltip:
When you click this, a text box will appear with
a token property you can add to your Campaign
Property token properties to automatically
add the Use Disguise button to tokens.

macros.label: Bag of Tricks Macros
macros.command: [r:bot_MacroButtonsOTMSetup()]

macros.label: Build Forest
macros.command: [r:bot_buildForest()]
macros.tooltip: <html>Select a one ore more images of a Tree top (Canopy) and click this button to randomly spread them over an area</html>

macros.label: Choose Crowd
macros.command: [h:bot_chooseCrowd()]
macros.tooltip:
This will show a form where you can select or deselect crowd tokens images
which are on the BASE map. The checked images will be (randomly) used for
the Create Crowd macro.

macros.label: Choose Trunks
macros.command: [r:bot_chooseTrunks()]
macros.tooltip:
This will show a form where you can select or deselect tree trunk images
which are on the BASE map. The checked images will be (randomly) used for the Canopy pads

macros.label: Clean Tok Names
macros.command: [h:bot_cleanTokNames()]
macros.tooltip:
There are certain characters e.g. @ # & that, when used in a token name,
can potentially break a macro IF that macro uses that token name. An obvious
example is getTokenNames(",") which returns a , seperated list. Should one of
the tokens in that list be called e.g. "Fire Elemental, Giant" than the list
would thus consist out of "Fire Elemental" and "Giant".

This macro tracks these tokens down and reports them in the chat. You then have
the choice to either fix them automatically or not.

macros.label: Contract Group
macros.command: [h:bot_contractGroup()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and contract the other tokens with an offset of X=-1 and Y=-1

macros.label: Convert Trap/Pits
macros.command: [r:bot_convertTrapPit()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro will convert ALL Pits and Traps on ALL (not excluded) maps to EventPads.
For pits you will need to rewrite the macro slightly before it works again.

macros.label: Copy / Del. Macro
macros.command: [H: bot_cpyDelMacros()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro allows you to select macros on the selected token. The selected macros you can copy or delete.

In case of copy, they will be stored in a property on lib:EventMacros. When you select another token you can
click Paste Macros. This will open a similar frame where you can select the macros to paste on the selected
token.
In case of delete you have the option to allow undo. The selected macros will be deleted from the token
and if allow undo is turned on, they will be stored in a property on that token. So you can later choose to undo the
process.

macros.label: Create Crowd
macros.command: [h:bot_createCrowd()]
macros.tooltip:
Same as choose trunks. Creates a list of tokens which 'Create Crowd' uses.
Based on tokens on BASE map starting name with 'Crowd '

macros.label: Define Area
macros.command: [h,macro("defineArea@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html>With this macro you can define an Event Area which you then can link to an event macro, to be triggered when a token moves over this area.

macros.label: Diagnose Maps
macros.command: [h:bot_diagnose()]
macros.tooltip:
Map diagnosis. This function checks ALL maps and ALL (lib)tokens for potential issues.
It checks whether token names contain non-alphanumerical characters and checks the libs for the
same and owner ship and visibility. Any errors are rendered in a frame with hyperlinks that lead
you to the token.

macros.label: Draw Area
macros.command: [h,macro("toggleAreaDraw@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This macro fills up an area with tokens. You can either select ONE token and run it, or run it without selection.
If you select one token before you run this then that token will be added to the dropdown.

macros.label: Draw Order
macros.command: [h, macro("openOrderFrame@Lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This opens a 'group select' frame which is required for the 'Select Group' to function.
When this panel is closed you can still group and ungroup, but the 'auto select' will only
work when this frame is active.

macros.label: Echelon Formation
macros.command: [h:bot_formationEchelon()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and put them in formation

macros.label: Execute AssignPads
macros.command: [h:bot_execAssignPads()]
macros.tooltip:
Before you can use this macro you first need to assign token to the special Assignpads.
Once that is done, you can run this macro and pick the Assignpads to be executed.
On execution the linked token will be moved to its assigned pad.

macros.label: Execute Event
macros.command: [r:bot_executeEvent()]
macros.tooltip: Select a door (that has been initialized) and click this button to open or close it

macros.label: Execute event
macros.command: [r:bot_executeEvent()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro generates a list of macros per group from the lib:Event token.
You can select one or more macros which then will be executed

macros.label: Fill Area
macros.command: [h,macro("fillArea@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html>This macro fills a predefined area with tokens</html>

macros.label: Find Duplicates
macros.command: [h:bot_findDuplicates()]
macros.tooltip: Give a list of all tokens of all layers on current map that have the same name

macros.label: Formation Buttons
macros.command: [h:bot_MacroButtonsGroupMove()]
macros.tooltip:
Select a group of tokens to group them for group move.
Note that any previous set groups for any of the tokens will be
cleared if you run this macro.
Also note that this macro makes use of the label field of the
token and any current value will get overwritten!!. Changing
this value after a group has been set will de-activate group-
movement when you move THAT token. The token will still be
part of the group and will be moved if another token of the
group is moved

macros.label: Frame Overview
macros.command: [h:bot_frameOverview()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro toggles shows an
overview of all Nildiks frames.

macros.label: Group (Move)
macros.command: [h:bot_setGroup()]
macros.tooltip:
Select a group of tokens to group them for group move.
Note that any previous set groups for any of the tokens will be
cleared if you run this macro.
Also note that this macro makes use of the label field of the
token and any current value will get overwritten!!. Changing
this value after a group has been set will de-activate group-
movement when you move THAT token. The token will still be
part of the group and will be moved if another token of the
group is moved

macros.label: Group (Select)
macros.command: [h, macro("setSelectGroup@Lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This macro creates a 'select group' of all currently selected tokens.
After a group is set (and the group select frame is active) when you
select one token of the group, all the other tokens of the group will be
automatically selected as well. This is particularly usefull when drawing
maps and you want to group a set of tokens into one object.

macros.label: Initialize Pads
macros.command: [r:bot_initializePads()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro cycles through all maps in the campaign file
looking for special pads. It will initialize any special pad it
encounters and report any errors on the way

macros.label: Line Formation
macros.command: [h:bot_formationLine()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and put them in formation

macros.label: Lock Movement
macros.command: [h:bot_movementLock()]
macros.tooltip: <html>When this is turned ON, no PLAYER can move a token, only the GM can.</html>

macros.label: Lock Token
macros.command: [h:bot_tokenLock()]
macros.tooltip:
When this is turned ON, no one (gm included) can move the selected token(s).
For this to work the toggle in the settings: 'Lock Movement for Locked Tokens' needs to be turned on!

macros.label: Manual
macros.command: [h:bot_manualText()]

macros.label: Map Editor
macros.command: [h:bot_mapEditor()]
macros.tooltip: Creates an overlay on the token layer where you can quickly create a new map.

macros.label: Mass VBL
macros.command: [h,macro("MassVBL@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html>This function draws VBL crosses on all tokens that match a search string

macros.label: Setup Sound Pad
macros.command: [macro("setupSound@Lib:OnTokenMove"):""]

macros.label: Move Crowd
macros.command: [h:bot_moveCrowd()]
macros.tooltip:
Disperses a crowd created by the 'Create Crowd' macro.
Make sure the antagonist is on the map.

macros.label: Move Crowd +
macros.command: [h:bot_moveCrowdPlus()]
macros.tooltip:
Disperses a crowd created by the 'Create Crowd' macro.
Make sure the antagonist is on the map.

This macro uses more intelligence however and is more realistic
but MUCH slower (roughly 1 second per 10 tokens)

macros.label: Move Token
macros.command: [r:bot_animateMove()]
macros.tooltip: <html>This macro will animate the movement of the selected token. An options panel will be shown first.</html>

macros.label: Move to hidden
macros.command: [h:bot_moveToHidden()]
macros.tooltip: Belongs to the map editor. Moves all pasted tokens to the HIDDEN layer so they're no longer visible

macros.label: Move to token
macros.command: [h:bot_moveToToken()]
macros.tooltip: Belongs to the map editor. Moves all hidden tokens back to the TOKEN layer.

macros.label: Packed-Wedge
macros.command: [h:bot_formationPWedge()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and put them in formation

macros.label: Pads Explorer
macros.command: [h:bot_initializeMap()]
macros.tooltip: Show overview of special pads on map

macros.label: Paste Macros
macros.command: [H: bot_pasteMacros()]
macros.tooltip:
This button you can use to paste macro on the selected token. Before you do this, you first need to run the
Copy/Del Macros button on another token.

macros.label: Quit Editor
macros.command: [h:bot_quitEditor()]
macros.tooltip: removes the overlay and the states of the pasted tokens

macros.label: Remove %20
macros.command: [r:bot_removeP20()]
macros.tooltip: This macro replaces %20 with spaces " " in the selected token names

macros.label: Renumber Tokens
macros.command: [r:bot_renumberToks()]
macros.tooltip:
When you have used the scatter function
(especially icw Spread) then you need to
renumber the scattered tokens before you
hit the initialize pads. Assuming that you
have scattered special tokens onto the map

macros.label: Reset Pit
macros.command: [h:setTokenImage(getTokenPortrait())]
macros.tooltip:
This will reset a sprung pit. Select the pit and click this button
This macro can also be put on the selection panel of the token.

macros.label: Rotate CCW
macros.command: [h:bot_rotateCCW()]
macros.tooltip: Select a 'group' token and rotate the other corresponding group tokens around it

macros.label: Rotate CW
macros.command: [h:bot_rotateCW()]
macros.tooltip: Select a 'group' token and rotate the other corresponding group tokens around it

macros.label: DiceBox
macros.command: [h:dbxLaunch()]
macros.tooltip:
Opens a form with dices where you can set a group of dice to roll
The workings of the Dice box are pretty obvious. What might not be
obvious is that it supports 10 different dice boxes. You can click the
macro 10 times and set each frame individually.

macros.label: Scatter Tokens
macros.command: [r:bot_scatter()]

macros.label: Seek Token
macros.command: [h,macro("seekToken@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This macro searches ALL maps and ALL tokens and
return those tokens of which the first part of
their name matches with the entered search string
Pop-ups on first use

macros.label: Set Door
macros.command: [r:bot_setDoor()]
macros.tooltip: To use the Toggle Door(s) macro, select one or more doors and click this button to set it up

macros.label: Set Draw Order
macros.command: [h:bot_setDrawOrder()]
macros.tooltip:
This is just a handy macro where you can manually set the draw order of the token.
A high number means on top of all a low number means below all.
Then current number (draw order) is shown when you run this macro on a token

macros.label: Set Event Button
macros.command: [r:bot_setEventButton()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro can be used to link an Event Macro to a Event Button.

1. Create a macro on the lib:EventMacros token in the group: 'Event Button Macros', containing the
code that is activated when the button, e.g. 'Switch To Map'
2. Select the button (any token will do) to which that macro should apply e.g. "Switch to Fair Haven"
3. Run this macro
4. Select "Switch Map" from the list
5. In the "Give Arguments" box enter the arguments as a stringproperty, e.g."toMap=Fair Haven"

Here it is important that both the the arguments name (toMap) and the arguments (Fair Haven)
contains ONLY alphanumeric characters!
Note that you can give multiple arguments! Just seperate them with a

macros.label: Set Event Pad
macros.command: [r:bot_setEventPad()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro can be used to link an Event Macro to an EventPad

1. Create a macro on the lib:EventMacros token in the group:
'Event Pad Macros', containing the code that is activated when the
Event is triggered. For example 'Spear Trap
2. Select an 'Event token'. This is a token which name starts with
'EventPad ' e.g. 'EventPad 1' or 'EventPad Pit Trap'.
This token can be placed on any layer
3. Run the macro 'Set Event Pad'
4. Pick an Event macro from the list, e.g. 'Standard Pit'
5. Then select the events on which this macro is triggered
7. Click OK
8. Run 'Initialize Maps'

The Event Pad is now set

macros.label: Set Light Source
macros.command: [r:bot_setLightSource()]
macros.tooltip:
The power of this button is that you can apply it to multiple tokens at once.
Select all tokens you want to set the light for before you hit this button.
You can set light sources to exclude in the settings.
Make sure that no lightsource in the campaign setting contains a comma: ,

macros.label: Set Reference
macros.command: [h:bot_setReference()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro is used to setup the Shadow pads.
To sync the movement of the shadow token to the real token two reference tokens are required.

To set this up do the following:
1. create two tokens with the same name where one has the suffix '

macros.label: Set Roof
macros.command: [r:bot_setRoof()]
macros.tooltip:
Here you can give a list of 'entry doors' through which a token can
enter the building. Note that these doors MUST be on the edge of the
roof (like real doors). If you leave this list empty, a token can move
anywhere on or over the 'roof' token

macros.label: Set Token Size
macros.command: [h,macro("setTokSize@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This macro is usufull is you want to use Alt Init Pads macro to initialize a map.
With this macro you can pre-set the size of a token. So you won't be asked
for it when you run alt. init. maps.
Note that you only need to do this for free size tokens

macros.label: Set VBL Stamp
macros.command: [h,macro("setVBLStamp@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html>This function applies a VBL (Vision Blocking Layer) upon a token. The VBL will move with the token as you move it.

macros.label: Settings
macros.command: [r:bot_settings()]

macros.label: Show Handout
macros.command: [h,macro("showHandout@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html> Pops up a dialog showing the handout of the selected token on all selected clients

macros.label: Spread Group
macros.command: [h:bot_spreadGroup()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and spread the other tokens with an offset of X=1 and Y=1

macros.label: Square Formation
macros.command: [h:bot_formationSquare()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and put them in formation

macros.label: StaggerFormation
macros.command: [h:bot_formationStagger()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and put them in formation

macros.label: Summon Token
macros.command: [r:bot_summonToken()]
macros.tooltip:
With this macro you can summon any token from the BASE map that is on the TOKEN layer.
If you select a token first before you click this button then the to-summon-token(s) will be
placed on the selected token. Else you can enter x and y coordinates of where you want to summon
the token. The types of tokens listed in the Dialog can be specified through the settings.

macros.label: Switch Map
macros.command: [h,macro("switchMap@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
Forces ALL clients to chosen map AND centres view on the token centreOnMePad

If you select tokens before you use this macro, then the option will be added to move
the selected tokens to the new map as well. These tokens will be placed near the centreOnMePad

If there is no centreOnMePad then the coords (X,Y) 0,0 will be used instead.

macros.label: Toggle Door
macros.command: [r:bot_toggleDoor()]
macros.tooltip: Select a door (that has been initialized) and click this button to open or close it

macros.label: Toggle Doors
macros.command: [r:bot_toggleDoors()]
macros.tooltip:
This will show a pop-up with all the initialized doors
on the OBJECT LAYER. Here you can select which to open/close

macros.label: Toggle EventMove
macros.command: [r,macro("toggleOnTokenMove@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
This will disable/enable the onTokenMoveEvent macros.
The onTokenMoveEvent can be demanding for every move
a token makes, especially when creating a map this can be
annoying. By clicking on this button you can temporarily
disable the event. Clicking it again will turn it on again.

macros.label: Toggle Full Screen
macros.command: [h,macro("toggleFullScreen@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip:
When toggled, the frames will be changed into dialogs,
which ARE allowed in full screen. This way when you
toggle this button you can have acces to chat and macros
in the form of dialogs.
In addition, when you have turned on the redefine broadcast
setting in the settings, then when using the broadcast() function
a dialog will pop up showing the last message broadcasted.

macros.label: Toggle Lock
macros.command: [r:bot_toggleLock()]
macros.tooltip: Select a door (that has been initialized) and click this button to open or close it

macros.label: Toggle Mass VBL
macros.command: [h,macro("toggleMassVBL@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html>With this function you can toggle saved mass VBL structures (set with Mass VBL macro) on and off

macros.label: Toggle Special
macros.command: [r:bot_toggleSpecial()]
macros.tooltip:
This macro toggles Canopy,
Foliage or Roofs on or off.
This also resets the tokens.

macros.label: Undo Del. Macros
macros.command: [H: bot_undoDelMacros()]
macros.tooltip:
If you deleted macros on the selected token using the Copy/Del Macros function
AND you had allow undo turned on, then you can use this function to undo
that process

macros.label: Ungroup (Move)
macros.command: [h:bot_clearGroup()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token from a group and use this macro to clear the ENTIRE group

macros.label: Ungroup (Select)
macros.command: [h, macro("clearSelectGroup@Lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html>This ungroups a 'Select Group'. You only need to select one token of the group to ungroup the entire group

macros.label: Use Disguise
macros.command: [H: bot_useDisguise()]
macros.tooltip:
- Clicking the Use Disguise button will add the current token image to your disguise list.
- Changing your image and clicking the button again will add a new image to list.
OR
- Selecting image:tokens together with the token will add those images to the disguise
list of the token

- A list will be shown for all the possible images you have loaded.
- You have the option to Change or Delete an image from your list.
- On the lib file, if you click autoDisguiseButton a text box will appear with a token
property you can add to your Campaign Property token properties to automatically add the
Use Disguise button to tokens.

macros.label: VBL Grenade
macros.command: [h,macro("VBLGrenade@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: <html>Select one or more tokens, run macro, set radius (in grid cells) and ALL VBL in that radius around the selected tokens will be cleared.</html>

macros.label: Wedge Formation
macros.command: [h:bot_formationWedge()]
macros.tooltip: Select one token of a group and put them in formation

macros.label: Whisper Frame
macros.command: [h:bot_whisperFrame()]
macros.tooltip:
This opens a frame where you can send formatted text to specific players.
Alternatively you can send a message to all players as if you
impersonate the selected token, without actually needing to impersonate it.

Notes
- you must either be the gm or own the selected token to do this.
- the impersonation ONLY works with all players check box
selected. (So not when some or all the individual player checkboxes are
selected!!)

macros.label: reset ALL props
macros.command: [r,macro("deleteProps@lib:OnTokenMove"):""]
macros.tooltip: (copy to Campaign panel)

macros.label: Canopy
macros.command:
[h:'<!------------------------------------------CANOPY------------------------------------------------->']
[h:canopyTriggered = movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h,if(json.contains(canopyTriggered,startingLocation) || json.contains(canopyTriggered,currentLocation)), CODE:{
	[switchToken(padName)]
	[inHouse = if(json.contains(canopyTriggered,currentLocation), 1, 0)]
['pause("inHouse","canopyTriggered","currentLocation","padName", "lastPath")']
	[r,macro("roofSwap@this"): json.append("", inHouse, tok, padName, 0)]
	[switchToken(tok)]
}; {}]

macros.label: EventArea
EventPad
macros.command:
[h:'<!-- -------------------------------------------- EventPad --------------------------------------------------->']
<!-- NOTE THAT ALL OUTPUT IS IGNORED, SO THE ONLY WAY TO GET SOMETHING TO THE CHAT IS BY USING BROADCAST! -->
<!-- Routine for an EventPad, EventPad is only triggered when the test subject is moved on or over the Eventtoken-->
[h: eventPadTriggered = movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h, if(!json.isEmpty(eventPadTriggered)), CODE:{
	<!-- check which event type this token triggers this can be 
	- movedOn 
	- movedOff 
	- movedOver 
	- movedNot		when you move the token but place it back on its original spot
	- movedReturn	when you move the token AND use way points AND leave the token but end the move onto the token
	- movedRemain	when you move but remain on the token during the entire move 
	- movedWard		(1001)	when you move the token over or onto a Ward -->
	[h:eventTypeList	= getProperty("w42.bot.eventTypeList", padName)]
	[h:eventType		= bot_getEventType()]
	[h:triggered		= listContains(eventTypeList, eventType)]
	<!-- With the use of the campaign macro you can set the name of the macro that should be called when the event is triggered-->
	[h,if(triggered),CODE:{
		[h:macroName = getProperty("w42.bot.macroName", padName)]
		[h:args = json.append("", tok, eventType, padName, lastPath, eventPadTriggered, 'pad')]
		[h,macro(macroName+"@Lib:EventMacros"): args]
		[bot_playPadSound(padName, tok)]	
	}; {
		[h:macro.return=""]
	}]
}; {}]

macros.label: Foliage
macros.command:
[h:'<!------------------------------------------ FOLIAGE ------------------------------------------------->']
[h:foliageTriggered = movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h,if(!json.isEmpty(foliageTriggered)), CODE:{
	[switchToken(padName)]
	[inHouse = if(json.contains(foliageTriggered,currentLocation), 1, 0)]
	['foliageSwap(inHouse, tok, padName)']

	[args = json.append("", inHouse, tok, padName, 0)]
	[macro("roofSwap@this"): args]
	[switchToken(tok)]
}; {}]

macros.label: InterJump
InterJumpBorder
InterPad
InterPadBorder
macros.command:
[h:'<!-- ---------------------------------------- InterPadBorder ------------------------------------------------->']
[h:teleporterTriggered = movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h,if(!json.isEmpty(teleporterTriggered)), CODE:{

	[t			= json.get(lastPath,0,0)]
	[movedOn	= json.isEmpty(movedOverToken(padName,t))]
	[if(movedOn): bot_mapTeleport(strPropFromVars("tok, padName, doAbort, eventMacroPreInterTeleport, eventMacroPostInterTeleport,doScaleTeleport,doSwitchInterMap,pathPadList", "UNSUFFIXED"))]
}; {}]

macros.label: Linked
macros.command:
[h:'<!-- ---------------------------------------- LINKED ----------------------------------------------- -->']
<!-- @@ 3 CODE LEVELS -->

<!-- abort if moving on or over the pad -->
[linkedTriggered	= movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h:startOnPad		= if(json.contains(linkedTriggered,startingLocation), 1, 0)]
[h:endOnPad			= if(json.contains(linkedTriggered,currentLocation),  1, 0)]
<!-- "Linked 1 Roof 2" == "Match1 Match2 Match3 Match4" -->
[h:linkId			= getGroup(strfind(padName, "[^\\s]+"), 2, 0)]
[h:startLinkId		= if(startOnPad, linkId, startLinkId)]
[h:endLinkId		= if(endOnPad, linkId, endLinkId)]

['pause("linkedTriggered","startOnPad","endOnPad","linkId","lastLinkId","startLinkId","endLinkId")']

[h,if(!json.isEmpty(linkedTriggered) && startOnPad != endOnPad), CODE:{
	<!-- first check if you know what the end pad is and if not, figure it out. This is needed to make the right decision -->
	<!-- do NOT switchToken before movedOverToken as it then does NOT work. -->
	[if(startOnPad && endLinkId == ""), CODE:{
		[linkedAll		= getProperty("w42.bot.linked", padName)]
		[foreach(pad, linkedAll), CODE:{
			[tlinkedTriggered	= movedOverToken(pad,lastPath)]
			[endLinkId			= if(json.contains(tlinkedTriggered,currentLocation),  linkId, endLinkId)]
		''
		}]
	''
	};{}]
	
	<!-- if endLinkId remains empty then you moved OF the linked pads. If endlinkId == lastLinkId (it *can* have a different id) then you remained and nothing should be done. -->
	[if(endLinkID != lastLinkId), CODE:{
		[switchToken(padName)]
		[linkedBridge	= getProperty("w42.bot.linkedBridge")]
		[linkedTunnel	= getProperty("w42.bot.linkedTunnel")]
		[linkedSpecial	= lower(getProperty("w42.bot.linkedSpecial"))]
		<!-- If you ALSO moved over a "Bridge" token then do NOT activate -->
		[overBridge	= 0]
		[foreach(pad, linkedBridge):overBridge	= max(overBridge, !json.isEmpty(movedOverToken(pad,lastPath)))]

		<!-- If tunnels are linked ONLY activate the roof if moved over a tunnel -->
		[overTunnel	= if(listCount(linkedTunnel), 0, 1)]
		[foreach(pad, linkedTunnel):overTunnel	= max(overTunnel, !json.isEmpty(movedOverToken(pad,lastPath)))]
		
		<!-- if you move OFF a roof that is linked to a e.g. Canopy where you move ON to then the roof is handled last and all tokens are deactivated. To prevent this keep track of activation -->
		['activated	= max(   eval("activated"+linkId),min(!overBridge, overTunnel, endOnPad )   )']
		['set("activated"+linkId, activated)']

		[activate	= min(!overBridge, overTunnel, endOnPad)]

		<!-- execute all linked special pads -->
		[foreach(pad, linkedSpecial):bot_roofSwap(activate, tok, pad, if(bot_inStr(pad, "roof"),1,0), roofHaloColor)]
		
		['pause("linkedTriggered","startOnPad","endOnPad","linkId","lastLinkId","startLinkId","endLinkId","lastPath","padName","tok","pathPadList","linkedAll","linkedPads", "overBridge","overTunnel")']
		[switchToken(tok)]
	}]
	
''
}; {}]

macros.label: MappedPad
macros.command:
[h:'<!------------------------------------------ MappedPad ------------------------------------------------->']
[h:teleporterTriggered = movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h,if(json.contains(teleporterTriggered,currentLocation)), CODE:{
	[iMapped = eval(string(getProperty("w42.bot.MappedPad", padName)))]
	[teleportEndName = "MappedPad " + iMapped)]

	[Token(padName): 			startCentreX	= getTokenX(1)]
	[Token(padName): 			startCentreY	= getTokenY(1)]
	[Token(teleportEndName): 	endCentreX		= getTokenX(1)]
	[Token(teleportEndName): 	endCentreY		= getTokenY(1)]

	[bot_teleport(strPropFromVars("tok, padName, teleportEndName, startCentreX,startCentreY,endCentreX,endCentreY, eventPreMacroTeleport, eventPostMacroTeleport,doScaleTeleport", "UNSUFFIXED"))]
	[goto(tok)]
}; {}]

macros.label: PadEnd
macros.command:
[h:'<!------------------------------------------- TELEPORTS END ------------------------------------------------->']
[h:teleporterTriggered = movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h,if(json.contains(teleporterTriggered,currentLocation)), CODE:{
	[teleportEndName = replace(padName, "End", "Start")]
	[Token(padName): 			startCentreX	= getTokenX(1)]
	[Token(padName): 			startCentreY	= getTokenY(1)]
	[Token(teleportEndName): 	endCentreX		= getTokenX(1)]
	[Token(teleportEndName): 	endCentreY		= getTokenY(1)]

	[bot_teleport(strPropFromVars("tok, padName, teleportEndName, startCentreX,startCentreY,endCentreX,endCentreY, eventPreMacroTeleport, eventPostMacroTeleport,doScaleTeleport", "UNSUFFIXED"))]
	[goto(tok)]
}; {}]

macros.command:
[h:'<!------------------------------------------- PadEndBorder ------------------------------------------------->']
[h:teleporterTriggered = movedOverToken(padName,lastPath)]
[h,if(!json.isEmpty(teleporterTriggered)), CODE:{
	[t			= json.get(lastPath,0,0)]
	[movedOff	= !json.isEmpty(movedOverToken(padName,t))]
	[if(movedOff): return(0,"")] <!-- or movedRemain -->
	[teleportEndName = replace(padName, "End", "Start")]
	[Token(padName): 			startCentreX	= getTokenX(1)]
	[Token(padName): 			startCentreY	= getTokenY(1)]
	[Token(teleportEndName): 	endCentreX		= getTokenX(1)]
	[Token(teleportEndName): 	endCentreY		= getTokenY(1)]
